definitions.title: Def
definitions.body: † [[בִּלְעֲדֵי]] (perh. from [[בַּל]] and [[עַד]], [[עֲדֵי]] unto; Syr. bel9od = a)/neu, xwri/v; Nab. [[בלעד]] except, Eut:Nab 3:9)—sf. [[בִּלְעָדַי]] (3 t.), [[בַּלְעָדַי]] (4 t.), [[בִּלְעָדֶיךָ]] (once)—prop. not unto, hence apart from, except, without:

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: Job 34:32 [[בִּלְעֲדֵי אֶחֱזֶה]] except, apart from (what) I see myself, do thou instruct me. With sf. Ge 41:44 [[בִּלְעָדֶיךָ]] apart from thee, without thee, no one shall lift up the head, Is 45:6 for there is none [[בִּלְעָדָָי]] except me. Also with sf., as a particle of deprecation, Ge 14:24 [[בִּלְעָדַי]] not to me ! i.e. I claim nothing, (in our idiom) not at all ! Ge 41:16.

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: with [[מִן]], [[מִבַּלְעֲדֵי]] (so men bel9od without). (a) apart from, esp. with the collat. idea of without the knowledge and consent, Nu 5:20, 2Ki 18:25 ( = Is 36:10) am I now come up apart from, without ´[[י]] against this place to destroy it? Je 44:19 (cf. [[בִלְעָדֶיךָ]] Ge 41:44). (b) apart from, besides, except, Jos 22:19, 2Sa 22:32 ( = Ps 18:32) for who is God except ´[[י]]? v:Ps 18:32; similarly Is 43:11 [[וְאֵין מִבַּלְעָדַי מוֹשִׁיעַ]], Is 44:6, Is 44:8, Is 45:21.
